data.name: Travelcard
data.description:
TASK >>>

Create a function which takes 3 arguments:
1- credit (the amount of money you have on the card)
2- station_1 (the start of the journey)
3- station_2 (the destination)

AND
find out if you can make the travel between "station_1" and "station_2" with the given credit.

CHECK FOR STATIONS >>>

please make sure that the station names entered in the function are correct.
if not, return a message: "Invalid station" and the invalid station name.

CALCULATE THE COST OF TRAVEL >>>

prices:
the first array is zone_1
the second array is zone_2
the third array is zone_3
the fourth array is zone_4

traveling in one zone between 2 stations: cost = £1 (both stations are in the same zone).
traveling between two zones: cost = £2 (station_1 is one zone away from station_2).
traveling between three zones: cost = £3.
traveling between four zones: cost = £4.
(you are only making one journey in one direction at a time)

RETURN >>>

return a string with a message containing:
'YES! You can make it! You will have £AA left on your card.'
'NO WAY! Top-up £BB or more for this journey.'

where AA = remaining credit

where BB = top-up credit

have a nice journey! :-)
